channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024080382
item.description:
Report E-2024080382

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drums were positioned on pallets and loaded into the trailer by the generator. During the loading process, a small crack was sustained on the bottom of one drum from either the tip of a forklift, the corner of a pallet, or other drum pressing against it. The leak was not evident during the loading process or on the post-trip inspection on 7/25/24. The leak was identified while the drum was still on the trailer on 7/26/24. The spill was cleaned up by in-house staff and the original container was overpacked along with the spill clean up residual.

item.title: Report E-2024080459
item.description:
Report E-2024080459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: Avon
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 30th, 2024, at 09:48, personnel at the CSXT Avon Terminal, Avon Indiana, discovered UTLX 950697, a residue tank car which last contained Butadienes, Stabilized, leaking from the vapor. The car was isolated and the shipper was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-07-30-00096). CSX Hazardous Material Team Managers found the source of cause of release was the vapor line valve not fully closed and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. It was also noted that two other secondary securement plugs were less than tool tight. CSX personnel closed the valve and properly secured all secondary closures. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Tim B. Langford, Shell Chemical, 504-208-8193)

item.title: Report E-2024080576
item.description:
Report E-2024080576

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that a strong odor was emitting from the trailer when terminal personnel attempted to open the trailer. ERTS dispatched Clean Harbors to assist. Clean harbors arrived onsite and advised that a bug cap was not secured on one of the 55-gallon drums, releasing 1-cup of product during transit. Clean Harbors placed a new bung cap on the drum and cleaned the released material.

  • Description: It was reported that one (1) teaspoon of Watcon 1492 released from one (1) 5-gallon poly pail impacting the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the release with the available PPE on-site.

item.title: Report X-2024081309
item.description:
Report X-2024081309

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: TERRE HAUTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Aug 7th a package was found during the AM sort that had no marks or labels that indicated any dangerous goods where inside. However when the packge was moved a distinct aerosol can rattling sound was heard. The package was opened and 3 cans of UN1950 Aerosols, flammable, 2.1 were found inside. The package is being held at the station pending disposition.

item.description:
Report X-2024080978

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the loading process. The fiberboard box contained six plastic bottles in a plastic bag. One of the plastic bottles was punctured on the bottom causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024081223
item.description:
Report X-2024081223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00
